titles.title: Anatomical Structures, Cell Types, plus Biomarkers (ASCT+B) table for Small Intestine v1.1

descriptions.description: [Anatomical Structures, Cell Types, plus Biomarkers (ASCT+B) tables](https://hubmapconsortium.github.io/ccf/pages/ccf-anatomical-structures.html) aim to capture the nested *part_of* structure of anatomical human body parts, the typology of cells, and biomarkers used to identify cell types. The tables are authored and reviewed by an international team of experts.

alternateIdentfier.alternateIdentfierType: How to Cite This Data Table

alternateIdentfiers.alternateIdentfier: Teri Longacre, HuBMAP ASCT+B Tables. Small Intestine v1.1, https://doi.org/10.48539/HBM934.NJHF.526. Accessed on December 15, 2022.

alternateIdentfier.alternateIdentfierType: How to Cite ASCT+B Tables Overall

alternateIdentfiers.alternateIdentfier: Quardokus, Ellen, Bruce W. Herr II, Lisel Record, Katy Börner. 2021. [*HuBMAP ASCT+B Tables*](https://hubmapconsortium.github.io/ccf/pages/ccf-anatomical-structures.html). Accessed on December 15, 2022.
